bill_title: provide for the impoundment of certain motor vehicles for failure to maintain liability insurance and driving with a suspended or revoked driver license.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to provide for the impoundment of certain motor vehicles for failure to maintain liability insurance and driving with a suspended or revoked driver license. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. Whenever a criminal prosecution is instituted for failure to maintain motor vehicle liability insurance, and it appears to the court in which such prosecution is instituted or maintained that any vehicle has been operated without proof of financial responsibility pursuant to the provisions of this title or chapter 32-35, the court shall impound such vehicle and not permit it to be driven until the owner or operator of the vehicle complies with the requirements of chapter 32-35. Section 2. Whenever a criminal prosecution is instituted, and it appears to the court in which such prosecution is instituted or maintained that any vehicle has been operated by the person to whom the motor vehicle is registered while the driver license of that person is suspended or revoked, the court shall impound such vehicle and not permit it to be driven until that person's driver license has been restored or the motor vehicle has been re-registered.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to provide for the impoundment of certain motor vehicles for failure to maintain liability insurance and driving with a suspended or revoked driver license. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. Whenever a criminal prosecution is instituted for failure to maintain motor vehicle liability insurance, and it appears to the court in which such prosecution is instituted or maintained that any vehicle has been operated without proof of financial responsibility pursuant to the provisions of Title 32, the court may impound such vehicle and not permit it to be driven until the owner or operator of the vehicle complies with the requirements of chapter 32-35. Section 2. Whenever a criminal prosecution is instituted, and it appears to the court in which such prosecution is instituted or maintained that any vehicle has been operated by the person to whom the motor vehicle is registered while the driver license of that person is suspended or revoked, the court may impound such vehicle and not permit it to be driven until that person's driver license has been reinstated.
